name: Date/Time Range
description: The DR data type is used to specify a range of dates and/or times. It provides a structured way to represent time periods, appointment windows, treatment durations, and other temporal ranges commonly used in healthcare scheduling and clinical documentation. DR supports both date-only and date-time ranges, enabling flexible representation of healthcare time intervals.

DR.1.name: Range Start Date/Time
DR.1.description: The beginning date and/or time of the range. Specifies when the time period starts, using timestamp format for precise temporal boundaries.

DR.2.name: Range End Date/Time
DR.2.description: The ending date and/or time of the range. Specifies when the time period ends, completing the temporal boundary definition.

constraints.temporalLogic: Range Start Date/Time should typically be earlier than or equal to Range End Date/Time
constraints.precision: Both timestamps should use consistent precision levels
constraints.timezone: Timezone handling should be consistent across both components

generationHints.typical: Use realistic healthcare time ranges appropriate for clinical scenarios
generationHints.precision: Match precision to clinical requirements (date vs datetime)
generationHints.business: Consider business hours and healthcare facility schedules

validationRules.temporalOrder: DR.1 should be earlier than or equal to DR.2
validationRules.timestampValidation: Both components must be valid TS (timestamp) values
validationRules.precisionConsistency: Both timestamps should use consistent precision
validationRules.clinicalReasonableness: Time ranges should be clinically reasonable for the context

timezoneConsiderations.consistency: Both start and end times should use the same timezone
timezoneConsiderations.documentation: Timezone should be explicitly specified when critical
timezoneConsiderations.conversion: May require timezone conversion for multi-location healthcare
timezoneConsiderations.standardization: Consider using UTC for system-to-system communication

relatedDataTypes.DT: Date - for date-only ranges without time components
relatedDataTypes.CQ: Composite Quantity with Units - for duration with units
